description: Systematic workflow for implementing multiple fixes in parallel using git worktrees and auto-merge PRs
author: Claude Sonnet 4.5
use_cases: Epic or tracking issue with many sub-issues

workflow_summary.phase_1: Plan and group issues by dependencies
workflow_summary.phase_3: Implement, test, and create PRs with auto-merge
workflow_summary.phase_4: Monitor CI and fix failures in worktrees
workflow_summary.phase_5: Wait for dependencies, create next group

key_commands.cleanup: git worktree remove ../path && git worktree prune

lessons_learned: Create worktrees in dependency groups, not all upfront
Always read files before editing to see exact format
Update tests when changing production code behavior
Use Python scripts for batch operations across many files
Pre-commit hooks will auto-fix - just commit again
Auto-merge removes manual bottleneck - critical for parallel workflow
applicable_to: Any project with GitHub and CI/CD
not_applicable_to: Limited CI resources (parallel PRs can overwhelm)
